results_summary: The study describes the design of a randomized cross-over trial but does not report results, as it appears to be a protocol or rationale paper.
population_specificity: 40 healthy older adults (aged 65 to 75 years) with subclinical or clinical insomnia from the Dutch municipality of Leiden and surroundings.
effective_dosage: Not specified (physical activity intervention, not DIM-related).
study_duration: Three 14-day intervention periods separated by 1-week wash-out periods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether a combination of bright light therapy, sleep advance instructions, and light reduction in the evening could reduce social jetlag and improve glycemic and metabolic control in people with prediabetes and type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study does not report results for DIM, as it focuses on bright light therapy and sleep interventions rather than DIM supplementation.
population_specificity: People with prediabetes or type 2 diabetes and >1 hour of social jetlag.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not involve DIM).
study_duration: 3 weeks of intervention, with follow-up at 12 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the expression of circulating immune cell markers in South African PDAC patients of African ancestry to understand their potential roles in tumor progression and immunotherapeutic strategies.
results_summary: The study found elevated granulocyte and neutrophil levels and decreased lymphocytes with PDAC severity, along with changes in T-cell and NK cell populations, suggesting their involvement in disease progression.
population_specificity: South African PDAC patients of African ancestry, including healthy volunteers, chronic pancreatitis patients, and PDAC patients (resectable, locally advanced, and metastatic).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the complexity of the peripheral immunophenotype in systemic autoimmune diseases (SADs) to facilitate differential diagnosis and identify potential therapeutic targets.
results_summary: The study identified 17 main immune cell types using single-cell mass cytometric immunophenotyping of PBMCs from healthy controls and therapy-naive patients with RA, SSc, and SLE. No specific findings regarding DIM were reported.
population_specificity: Healthy controls and therapy-naive patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA), progressive systemic sclerosis (SSc), and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of CM313, a novel anti-CD38 monoclonal antibody, in treating adult patients with immune thrombocytopenia (ITP).
results_summary: CM313 rapidly increased platelet levels by inhibiting antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity and maintained long-term efficacy by clearing plasma cells, with 95% of patients achieving two consecutive platelet counts of at least 50×10^9/L, and it was associated with mainly low-grade toxic effects.
population_specificity: Adult patients with immune thrombocytopenia (ITP).
effective_dosage: 16 mg per kilogram of body weight every week.
study_duration: 8 weeks of treatment followed by a 16-week follow-up period.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to explore the potential role of natural killer (NK) cells in neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding DIM's effects, only mentioning the ambiguous function of NK cells in neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not mention a specific population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantify light as a stimulus for the circadian system and establish a dose-response relationship to reduce depression symptoms among adolescents and young adults (AYAs).
results_summary: The study found greater response potentials of circadian-active bright light therapy (BLT) among AYAs, considering factors like co-medication and disease severity. A dose-response relationship with quantified circadian stimulus and temporal pattern was elaborated to support clinical depression treatment.
population_specificity: Adolescents and young adults (AYAs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I) alone versus CBT-I combined with bright light therapy (BLT) in reducing insomnia severity and improving circadian, mood, and daytime functioning in youths with insomnia and eveningness.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a randomized controlled trial design but does not provide results, as it appears to be a description of the planned methodology rather than a completed study.
population_specificity: Youths aged 12-24 with insomnia and eveningness.
effective_dosage: Bright constant green light (506 lx) for 30 minutes daily immediately after awakening.
study_duration: The intervention period includes six sessions of CBT-I, with follow-ups at 1 and 6 months post-intervention for active treatment groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between CD16 levels and mortality in adult patients with sepsis-associated ARDS.
results_summary: The study found that higher CD16 levels were associated with increased 28-day mortality in sepsis-associated ARDS patients, with a mortality rate of 22.5%.
population_specificity: Adult patients with sepsis-associated ARDS in the ICU.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if circulating endothelial cells, progenitor cells, and plasma angiogenic factors could predict clinical outcomes in metastatic renal cell carcinoma patients treated with tyrosine kinase inhibitors.
results_summary: Baseline CD45(dim)CD34(+)VEGFR2(+) progenitor cell levels were associated with progression-free survival and overall survival. Changes in progenitor cells and SDF-1α levels during treatment were also linked to survival outcomes.
population_specificity: 55 patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (46 on sunitinib, 9 on sorafenib).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of bright light exposure (BL) compared to dim light exposure (DL) on hippocampal dentate gyrus (DG) volume in patients with mood disorders.
results_summary: Bright light exposure significantly increased the volume of the left DG-head and left DG-total in patients with mood disorders, and these increases were positively correlated with mood improvement. The effects were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Patients with mood disorders (n=24, BL group=12, DL group=12).
effective_dosage: Bright light exposure (10,000 lx) vs. dim light exposure (50 lx).

study_goal: The researchers were examining delayed sleep phase disorder in adolescents, including its etiology, prevalence, clinical features, diagnostic tools, and treatment options.
results_summary: The study found that delayed sleep phase disorder has a prevalence of 1-16% and is associated with neurodevelopmental and psychiatric conditions. Diagnostic measures include history-taking, sleep logs, actigraphy, and dim light melatonin onset measurement, while treatments involve sleep hygiene, chronotherapy, melatonin, and bright light therapy.
population_specificity: Adolescents, particularly those with neurodevelopmental disorders (e.g., ADHD, autism) or psychopathology (e.g., anxiety, depression).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze differences in tumor response to immunotherapy between pulmonary lesions and liver metastases in NSCLC and explore potential mechanisms through multiomics analysis.
results_summary: The study found that liver metastases had a lower objective response rate and disease control rate compared to pulmonary lesions, with one-third of patients showing mixed responses. Multiomics analysis revealed limited genomic heterogeneity but lower immune activation and infiltration in liver metastases.
population_specificity: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with liver metastases receiving immunotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of bright light therapy (BLT) versus dim red light therapy (DRL) on sleep parameters and depression severity in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD) and eveningness.
results_summary: The study found that BLT led to greater advances in subjective sleep timings compared to DRL, but both groups showed comparable improvements in wake after sleep onset (WASO), total sleep time (TST), and sleep efficiency (SE). No significant differences were observed in actigraphic parameters between the two groups post-treatment.
population_specificity: Adults with major depressive disorder (MDD) and eveningness (n=93).
effective_dosage: 50 lux dim red light therapy (DRL) daily for 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of a chronotype-tailored bright light intervention on sleep disturbance, fatigue, depressive mood, cognitive dysfunction, and quality of life among post-treatment breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: The study found no significant between-group differences in symptoms or quality of life, but within each group, self-reported sleep disturbance, fatigue, depressive mood, cognitive dysfunction, and quality of life-related functioning showed significant improvements over time. Polysomnography results indicated reduced awakenings with bright light and increased stage 2 sleep with dim-red light.
population_specificity: Post-treatment breast cancer survivors (30 women, 1-3 years post-completion of chemotherapy and/or radiation for stage I to III breast cancer, mean age 52.5 ± 8.4 years).
effective_dosage: 30-min daily bright blue-green light (12,000 lx) or dim red light (5 lx) either between 19:00 and 20:00 h or within 30 min of waking in the morning.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effectiveness of a cognitive behavioral sleep intervention (TranS-C) in adolescents with an evening circadian preference and clinically significant depressive symptoms, and to evaluate improved alignment between circadian biology and sleep-wake behavior as a potential mechanism for depression symptom improvement.
results_summary: TranS-C significantly reduced Major Depressive Disorder severity at 12-month follow-up compared to an active control condition. Improved alignment between circadian biology and sleep-wake behavior at posttreatment was associated with better depression outcomes at 12-month follow-up under the treatment condition.
population_specificity: Adolescents with an evening circadian preference and clinically significant depressive symptoms.
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated, but follow-up assessments occurred at 6 and 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to review gene therapy approaches to address potential metabolic shortcomings in cones affected by retinitis pigmentosa.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding DIM's effects, as it focuses on gene therapy for retinitis pigmentosa rather than DIM.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses retinitis pigmentosa generally).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effects of an inpatient management system (CircadianCare) on enhancing circadian rhythmicity and limiting the negative impact of hospitalization on sleep.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of CircadianCare or DIM.
population_specificity: Fifty inpatients.

study_goal: The abstract does not mention DIM, so no study goal related to DIM can be determined.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention DIM, so no results related to DIM can be summarized.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not mention DIM).
effective_dosage: Not available (abstract does not mention DIM).
study_duration: Not available (abstract does not mention DIM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the clinical, radiological, and pathological characteristics of diffuse intrapulmonary mesothelioma (DIM) to aid in accurate diagnosis and avoid misdiagnosis.
results_summary: The study identified DIM as a rare form of pleural mesothelioma with distinctive intrapulmonary growth, minimal pleural involvement, and clinical/radiological resemblance to interstitial lung disease. Diagnosis was confirmed through immunohistochemical staining and genetic testing, revealing specific marker expressions (e.g., CK, WT-1 positivity) and BAP1 loss.
population_specificity: A 59-year-old man with recurrent pleural effusions and asbestos exposure history.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of intensive neoadjuvant treatment (three cycles of camrelizumab plus nab-paclitaxel and capecitabine) on tumor regression and survival outcomes in patients with locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC).
results_summary: The study found that three cycles of treatment significantly improved pathological response rates (33.3% complete response, 64.3% major response) and survival outcomes (1-year DFS and OS both 97.6%, 2-year DFS 92.3%, OS 97.6%). Most adverse events were mild (grades 1-2), and no surgical delays occurred.
population_specificity: Locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) patients.
effective_dosage: Three cycles of camrelizumab plus nab-paclitaxel and capecitabine (specific dosages not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: Three cycles (exact duration per cycle not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of scheduled dim light as a circadian intervention for insomnia subtypes, particularly for difficulty falling asleep or early morning awakenings.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that scheduled dim light, among other circadian interventions, may benefit insomnia patients when administered adjunctively to cognitive-behavioral therapy, with effectiveness varying by insomnia subtype.
population_specificity: Patients with insomnia, particularly those reporting difficulty falling asleep or early morning awakenings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of I3C and its metabolite DIM in preventing and treating chronic diseases by examining their mechanisms of action at cellular and molecular levels.
results_summary: The study found that I3C and DIM modulate multiple signaling pathways, influencing cellular processes like inflammation, apoptosis, and immunity, with strong potential to prevent chronic diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and neurodegenerative disorders. Preclinical evidence supports their beneficial effects, though clinical relevance requires further validation.
population_specificity: Preclinical studies (in vitro and in vivo models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the distribution and gene expression of endometrial immune cell populations, particularly NK subsets, in women with recurrent miscarriages compared to healthy donors, and explore potential relationships with KIR genotypes and KIR-HLA-C binding.
results_summary: The study found a higher percentage of CD56+ NK cells with a cytotoxic profile in the endometrium of women with recurrent miscarriages, but no direct relationship was observed between this cellular increase and KIR genotypes or KIR-HLA-C binding.
population_specificity: 39 women with recurrent miscarriages who underwent IVF with donated oocytes and 21 healthy oocyte donors with proven fertility.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of morning bright light treatment versus dim light treatment on pain, function, mood, sleep, and circadian timing in fibromyalgia patients.
results_summary: Both bright and dim light treatments led to significant and clinically meaningful improvements in pain intensity, pain interference, physical function, depressive symptoms, and sleep disturbance, with no significant difference between the two treatments. Minimal side effects were observed.
population_specificity: 60 people with fibromyalgia (58 women, mean age 41.8 ± 13.3 years).
effective_dosage: 1-hour daily morning light treatment (bright or dim).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the occurrence and characteristics of ocular toxicities related to anti-cancer drugs, including first-in-class ones, in patients undergoing early-phase clinical trials.
results_summary: The study found that 7.6% of patients experienced ocular toxicities, with retinopathy being the most frequent. Most toxicities were bilateral, and about 60% required temporary drug holds, but nearly all cases fully recovered.
population_specificity: Patients involved in early-phase clinical trials with scheduled ophthalmologic examinations (median age 61 years, range 33-76 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, acceptability, and effectiveness of virtual delivery of bright light therapy and dim light therapy versus usual care for fatigue.
results_summary: The study hypothesizes that virtual N-of-1 RCTs will provide valuable information on implementing light therapy for fatigue, including usability, satisfaction, and symptom improvement, but results are not yet available.
population_specificity: 60 participants with fatigue.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different treatments (bright light alone vs. bright light combined with exercise and melatonin) on circadian adjustment to simulated jet lag.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study appears to be a proposed protocol rather than a completed study with findings.
population_specificity: 36 adults undergoing simulated jet lag in a laboratory setting.
study_duration: 6.5 consecutive days in the laboratory, with 3 days on a delayed schedule.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of 1.0% phentolamine mesylate ophthalmic solution (PMOS) in improving vision and image quality for patients with severe dim light vision disturbances (DLD).
results_summary: PMOS significantly reduced pupil diameter, improved contrast sensitivity, and enhanced visual acuity under mesopic and photopic conditions. It was well tolerated, with only mild conjunctival hyperemia reported as a side effect.
population_specificity: Adults with severe DLD who reported persistent night vision difficulties not corrected by spectacles and had below-normal contrast sensitivity under mesopic conditions with glare.
effective_dosage: One dose of 1.0% phentolamine mesylate ophthalmic solution.
study_duration: Single-dose intervention (duration not specified beyond immediate post-treatment assessment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether melatonin (with or without bright light therapy) advanced sleep times and improved sleep quality in adults with ADHD and delayed sleep phase syndrome (DSPS), potentially explaining the reduction in ADHD symptoms.
results_summary: Melatonin advanced the dim-light melatonin onset (DLMO) but did not advance sleep times or improve sleep quality. Combining melatonin with bright light therapy further advanced DLMO but also did not affect ADHD symptoms or sleep timing.
population_specificity: Adults (18-55 years) with ADHD and delayed sleep phase syndrome (DSPS).
effective_dosage: 0.5 mg/day melatonin, with or without 30 minutes of bright light therapy (BLT) between 0700 and 0800 h.
study_duration: 3 weeks of treatment, with follow-up 2 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether DIM supplementation could increase the Estrogen Metabolites Urine Ratio (EMUR) in premenopausal women with a low baseline EMUR.
results_summary: DIM supplementation did not increase EMUR at 30 days of treatment, and no significant changes were observed in body composition. The abstract does not report results for the 30-day post-supplementation period.
population_specificity: Premenopausal women with an EMUR below 0.9.
effective_dosage: 75 mg of DIM daily (administered as 300 mg of DIM-BR®).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing literature on CD20 expression on T cells and summarize the current understanding of these cells and their function.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about DIM's effects, only mentioning a review of CD20 expression on T cells. No conclusions about DIM are presented.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on CD20 expression in T cells, not a specific human population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the efficacy of Sini powder (SNP) in treating depression by regulating circadian rhythm, specifically assessing its impact on dim light melatonin onset (DLMO) and phase angle difference (PAD).
results_summary: SNP significantly improved DLMO and PAD after 4 weeks of treatment, with DLMO showing greater improvement. SNP combined with paroxetine tablets effectively improved circadian rhythms in MDD patients, and HAMD-24 scores decreased significantly over time.
population_specificity: 36 patients with major depressive disorder (MDD)
study_duration: 4 weeks of medication, 6 weeks of follow-up

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a circadian-based intervention (including earlier bedtimes and morning bright light) could shift sleep onset earlier and extend school-night sleep duration in adolescents with chronic sleep restriction.
results_summary: The intervention advanced circadian phase (DLMO) by 0.6 hours, led to falling asleep 1.5 hours earlier, and increased sleep duration by 1.2 hours compared to the control group, which showed no systematic changes. Adolescents with later circadian phases benefited most from both time management and morning bright light.
population_specificity: Adolescents (14.5-17.9 years; 24 females) with habitual short sleep (≤7 hours) and late bedtimes (≥23:00) on school nights.
effective_dosage: Bright light (~6000 lux; 2.5 hours) on two mornings during the second weekend.
study_duration: 2 weeks baseline + 3 weekends + 2 sets of 5 weekdays (total ~4 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bright white light therapy (BWL) improves cognitive function in hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT) survivors compared to dim red light (DRL).
results_summary: The study found significant main effects for time on objective and self-reported cognitive function, suggesting bright light therapy may improve cognition in HSCT survivors. Secondary outcomes included improvements in cognitive domains, fatigue, sleep quality, and circadian rhythm robustness.
population_specificity: HSCT survivors with mild cognitive impairment at an urban U.S. hospital.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes of light therapy every morning upon awakening.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of bright light therapy (BLT) compared to dim red light (DRL) for treating perinatal depression (PND) across the perinatal period.
results_summary: BLT resulted in 73% remission (EPDS score ≤12) compared to 27% in the DRL group, with a significant group-time interaction favoring BLT. No major side effects were reported in either group.
population_specificity: Women with an EPDS >12 from the 2nd gestational trimester until 9 months postpartum.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes of morning BLT (10,000 lux) or DRL (19 lux).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the physiological processes underlying dark adaptation in the retina using electroretinogram (ERG) studies, focusing on cone-driven and rod-driven vision recovery.
results_summary: The study found that rod photoreceptor circulating current takes 30 minutes to recover after large bleaches, while cone current recovers within 100 ms, suggesting differences in how free opsin affects rod and cone phototransduction. ERG tracking of dark adaptation may have future clinical applications, including in age-related macular degeneration and retinal disease trials.
population_specificity: Not specified (general retinal physiology study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of NK cells in radiotherapy-induced immune responses, particularly involving a CXCL8/IL-8-dependent mechanism, in pancreatic cancer.
results_summary: The study found that CXCL8 increased under radiotherapy, and NK cell presence correlated with prolonged overall survival in pancreatic cancer patients. NK cells preferentially infiltrated irradiated tumors and exhibited CD56 expression.
population_specificity: Pancreatic cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the development and management of skin cancer using polymeric micro/nano carriers-based therapies, including drug/gene delivery and combination therapies.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the potential of polymeric carriers for efficient delivery of anticancer drugs and genes, overcoming barriers of conventional therapies, and highlights intelligent polymeric nanocarriers for combination therapies and theranostic applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the accuracy of a mathematical model (Hannay model) and sleep/wake parameters in predicting circadian phase (DLMO) in children.
results_summary: The Hannay model outperformed sleep/wake parameters in predicting DLMO, with higher concordance (LinCCC 0.79 vs. 0.41-0.59) and lower mean absolute error (31 min vs. 35-38 min). Sleep/wake behaviors were weak proxies for DLMO, but wearable data improved prediction accuracy.
population_specificity: 29 elementary school children (mean age 7.4 ± 0.97 years)
study_duration: 7 days of wrist actigraphy before DLMO assessment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether polychromatic short-wavelength-enriched light could improve vigilant attention, alertness, and mood after waking from slow-wave sleep compared to dim, red ambient light.
results_summary: Participants exposed to the short-wavelength-enriched light had fewer lapses in the Psychomotor Vigilance Task compared to the control condition, suggesting improved alertness and performance after waking.
population_specificity: Twelve healthy adults (six female, mean age 23.3 ± 4.2 years) with actigraphy-confirmed sleep schedules.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (light exposure intervention, not a supplement dosage).
study_duration: 1 hour of light exposure immediately after waking.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to address common myths and misconceptions about soft contact lenses using an evidence-based approach.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about DIM, as it focuses on debunking outdated beliefs about contact lenses rather than supplement efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses contact lens users and practitioners broadly).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document a rare case of erythrophagocytosis (EP) in de novo acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) and assess its prognostic significance.
results_summary: The study reported a rare case of EP in a pediatric ALL patient with blast vacuolization, aberrant CD33 expression, and t(12;21) translocation, who responded well to standard induction therapy. The findings suggest EP in de novo ALL may be associated with favorable genetic markers.
population_specificity: A five-year-old male with de novo B-cell ALL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of chronotypically tailored light therapy on fatigue and sleep disruption in female breast cancer survivors post-treatment.
results_summary: No between-group differences were found, but the experimental group reported significant decreases in fatigue after adjusting for baseline fatigue.
population_specificity: Female survivors 1-3 years post-completion of chemotherapy and/or radiation for stage I to III breast cancer.
effective_dosage: 30-min daily light therapy (bright blue-green or dim red light) for 14 consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize painful procedures, analgesic strategies, vital signs, and pain scores in hospitalized newborns.
results_summary: The study found that newborns underwent a high number of painful procedures, with dim lighting being the most common non-pharmacological strategy and continuous fentanyl the main pharmacological measure. Pain scores and vital signs showed variability, and the use of analgesic strategies was deemed insufficient.
population_specificity: Hospitalized newborns in a Brazilian public hospital intensive care unit.
study_duration: Evaluated between admission and the third day of admission.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of bright white light (BWL) versus dim red light (DRL) on quality of life and depressive symptoms in adolescents and young adults undergoing cancer treatment.
results_summary: BWL improved self-reported total depression, negative self-esteem, negative mood/physical symptoms, and emotional and school functioning compared to DRL. Parent-reported school functioning also showed greater improvement with BWL.
population_specificity: Adolescents and young adults (12-22 years, 51% male) newly diagnosed with cancer.
effective_dosage: Not specified (light therapy intervention, not DIM supplement).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the role of NK cell cytotoxicity in COVID-19 severity and potential therapeutic approaches, such as adoptive transfer of NK or CAR-NK cells.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the disruption of immune responses by SARS-CoV-2, particularly NK cell exhaustion, and suggests improving NK cell cytotoxicity as a potential treatment approach. No specific results regarding DIM are mentioned.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on general COVID-19 mechanisms).

study_goal: To examine the effectiveness of light therapy for cancer-related fatigue (CRF) in cancer patients through a systematic review and meta-analysis.
results_summary: Light therapy significantly improved CRF, depression, and sleep difficulty, with a non-significant trend for quality of life. The intervention showed consistent benefits across multiple cancer types.
population_specificity: Cancer patients (breast, ovarian, endometrial, multiple myeloma, lung, or combined cancers)
effective_dosage: Light intensities ranged from 417.9 to 12,000 lux (specific dosage not quantified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the progress in epidemiology, etiology, diagnostic evaluation, diagnostic criteria, and treatment of intrinsic circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders (CRSWDs).
results_summary: The abstract does not mention DIM or its effects, focusing instead on CRSWDs, their diagnosis, and treatments like sleep health education, time therapy, light therapy, melatonin, and hypnotic drug therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with intrinsic circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefit of hearing aids, specifically those with in-built masking facility (DIM), in managing tinnitus and compare its efficacy to other hearing aid designs.
results_summary: The study found that DIM hearing aids provided the best benefit in mitigating tinnitus, with a mean reduction of 51.9 points in THIT scores, outperforming other designs (D-Basic and DTS). DIM also showed superior relief across functional, emotional, and catastrophic domains of tinnitus severity.
population_specificity: 108 subjects (65 males, 43 females) aged 18-81 years with tinnitus, fitted with hearing aids based on clinical grounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate changes in neutrophil phenotypes, particularly CD16 and CD62L expression, during inflammatory conditions.
results_summary: The study found increased heterogeneity in neutrophil phenotypes during acute inflammation, characterized by elevated CD16 expression.
population_specificity: Not specified (neutrophils in inflammatory conditions)

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically address DIM (Diindolylmethane) or its effects.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention DIM or its effects.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson disease experiencing sleep disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of bright white light (BWL) therapy compared to dim red light (DRL) in improving cancer-related fatigue in patients with cancer.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that daily morning BWL for 30 minutes significantly improved fatigue severity compared to DRL, suggesting BWL is more effective for managing cancer-related fatigue.
population_specificity: Patients with cancer experiencing moderate-to-severe cancer-related fatigue.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of combined melatonin and bright light therapies on sleep and circadian outcomes.
results_summary: Combined therapy outperformed single therapies in phase advancing but not delaying dim light melatonin onset (DLMO). It was more beneficial than single therapy in elderly populations with cognitive decline but showed no benefit in delayed sleep-wake phase disorder (DSWPD) patients.
population_specificity: Healthy participants, elderly populations with cognitive decline, and DSWPD patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the development of diurnal rodent models for studying seasonal affective disorder (SAD) and its underlying mechanisms, including potential therapeutic approaches.
results_summary: The abstract highlights progress in developing diurnal rodent models for SAD, noting that these models show affective-like behavioral changes in response to short photoperiods or dim-light conditions, which can be ameliorated by bright light exposure. The orexinergic system is identified as a promising research avenue due to its role in functions disturbed in SAD.
population_specificity: Diurnal rodents (animal models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of continuous intravenous infusion of recombinant human interleukin-15 (rhIL-15) on NK cell expansion and its potential to enhance antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC) in patients with metastatic cancers.
results_summary: The study found that rhIL-15 administered via continuous intravenous infusion significantly expanded NK cells (mean 34-fold) and enhanced their cytotoxic functions, suggesting potential benefits for tumor-targeting monoclonal antibody therapies.
population_specificity: Eleven patients with metastatic cancers.

study_goal: The abstract does not mention DIM or its study goals.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss DIM or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on NK cells, not DIM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize structural insights into vertebrate rod opsin and its mutations linked to vision-impairing diseases, as well as discuss therapeutic strategies for adRP.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the atomic-level characterization of rod opsin, its role in photobleaching, and disease-linked mutations affecting folding and trafficking. It also mentions potential therapeutic strategies for adRP.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on molecular and structural biology of rod opsin)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of natural killer (NK) cells in HBV clearance and their relationship to antiviral treatment outcomes in chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients.
results_summary: The abstract is incomplete, but it suggests that PEG-IFN-α treatment in CHB patients may influence NK cell phenotypes, though specific outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: Chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients
study_duration: Measurements taken at weeks 12 and 24 from baseline

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of various light therapy (LT) measures in improving motor and non-motor symptoms in patients with idiopathic Parkinson's disease (PD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that LT significantly improved motor function, depression, and sleep disturbance-related scores in PD patients compared to dim-red light controls. The results provide strong evidence for LT's efficacy in PD symptom management.
population_specificity: Patients with idiopathic Parkinson's disease

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize standard MRD assessment techniques in B-ALL by flow cytometry and discuss challenges in detecting CD19-negative or dim B-ALL relapse.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about DIM but focuses on MRD assessment challenges in B-ALL, particularly CD19-negative relapse scenarios.
population_specificity: Patients with B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (B-ALL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of bright light therapy on sleep disruption, fatigue, daytime sleepiness, depression, and quality of life in women with stage I-III breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study compared blue-green light (12,000 lux) to dim red light (5 lux) administered via a light visor cap for 30 minutes daily over 21 days, but the abstract does not report specific outcomes regarding DIM.
population_specificity: Women with stage I-III breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the benefits of a one-catheter strategy versus a conventional two-catheter strategy in coronary catheterization, focusing on contrast consumption and procedural performance.
results_summary: The one-catheter strategy reduced radiological contrast administration by 3.831 mL, decreased radial spasm (OR 0.484), and shortened procedural time by 72.471 seconds compared to the two-catheter strategy, with no difference in fluoroscopy time.
population_specificity: 1,599 patients undergoing coronary catheterization (802 with one-catheter strategy, 797 with two-catheter strategy).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (catheterization procedure, not a supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bright light therapy (BLT) or dim red light therapy (DRLT) effectively reduces depressive symptoms in pregnant women with depression.
results_summary: Both BLT and DRLT groups showed significant reductions in depressive symptoms (40.6%-53.1% and 50.9%-66.7%, respectively), but no statistically significant difference was found between the two treatments. The study concluded that more research is needed to determine the nature of these responses.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (12-32 weeks gestational age) with a DSM-5 diagnosis of depressive disorder.
effective_dosage: DRLT (100 lux, 2700 K) administered daily for 30 minutes upon awakening.
study_duration: 6 weeks of therapy, with follow-ups up to 2 months postpartum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, clinical activity, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics of emactuzumab combined with selicrelumab in patients with advanced solid tumors.
results_summary: The combination showed a manageable safety profile with common adverse events like infusion-related reactions and fatigue, but no objective clinical responses were observed despite pharmacodynamic activity.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced solid tumors.
effective_dosage: Emactuzumab (500 to 1000 mg flat) and selicrelumab (2 to 16 mg flat) administered intravenously every 3 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether melatonin, alone or combined with bright light therapy, could improve circadian rhythm and ADHD symptoms in adults with ADHD and Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome (DSPS).
results_summary: Melatonin advanced the dim-light melatonin onset (DLMO) by 1h28, indicating a shift in circadian rhythm, though the abstract does not specify the full impact on ADHD symptoms. The combination of melatonin and bright light therapy showed additional benefits compared to melatonin alone.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-55 with ADHD and Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome (DSPS).
effective_dosage: 0.5 mg/d melatonin, with or without 30 minutes of 10,000 lux bright light therapy.
study_duration: 3 weeks of treatment, with follow-up two weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate CD38 expression on peripheral blood leukocyte subsets in SLE patients to assess its potential as a therapeutic target and biomarker.
results_summary: The study found that CD38 expression was significantly increased on circulating plasmacytoid dendritic cells and CD14+ monocytes in SLE patients compared to healthy controls, suggesting its relevance in SLE pathology.
population_specificity: 56 systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) patients across two cohorts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the involvement of AI in antibacterial drug development, including essential oils, and their potential role in addressing antimicrobial resistance.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about essential oils, only mentioning their inclusion in the systematic review of AI applications in antibacterial drug development.
population_specificity: Not specified (review study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Lippia alba essential oil's potential as a complementary treatment for breast cancer, focusing on its anticancer effects, synergy with conventional treatments, and safety profiles.
results_summary: The abstract suggests Lippia alba shows promise in breast cancer management, with potential anticancer effects on breast cancer cells and possible synergy with conventional treatments, but highlights the need for further research to confirm its therapeutic potential.
population_specificity: Breast cancer (no specific patient demographics provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential wound healing activities of essential oils through novel drug delivery systems.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that essential oils like lavender, tea tree, sesame, and olive show potential wound healing activities. It also mentions the therapeutic application of nanoformulations and emerging approaches like stem cell therapy and growth factor delivery for wound healing.
population_specificity: Not specified (general wound healing context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biochemical, pharmacological, and therapeutic effects of Myrtus communis, including its essential oils, to assess its potential applications in medicine.
results_summary: The study found that Myrtus communis essential oils contain bioactive compounds with anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, antioxidant, and other health benefits, supporting its therapeutic potential.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the current evidence on fenugreek's potential for functional food development, focusing on its bioactive components, including essential oils, and their health benefits.
results_summary: The abstract highlights fenugreek's broad-spectrum biological and pharmacological activities, including antioxidative, anti-inflammatory, and organ-protective effects, with potential applications in functional foods and nutraceuticals. Essential oils and other bioactive compounds in fenugreek seeds and leaves show promise but are only beginning to be explored in the food industry.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on dietary and nutraceutical applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the diverse health effects of peppermint, including its essential oils, and explore potential underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Peppermint exhibits antimicrobial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, immunomodulatory, anti-cancer, and other therapeutic properties, with benefits for gastrointestinal, psychological, cognitive, dental, and skin health, though it has paradoxical effects on sleep and alertness.
population_specificity: General human health applications (no specific population mentioned).
